```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)

library(readr)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(maps)
library(tidyverse)

```


```{r, Downloading data}

 # Readig in data 1

popvote_bystander <- read_csv("popvote_bystate_1948-2016.csv",col_types = cols(
  state = col_character(),
  year = col_double(),
  total = col_double(),
  D = col_double(),
  R = col_double(),
  R_pv2p = col_double(),
  D_pv2p = col_double()
))

 # Reading in data 2

popvote <- read_csv("popvote_1948-2016.csv",col_types = cols(
  year = col_double(),
  party = col_character(),
  winner = col_logical(),
  candidate = col_character(),
  pv = col_double(),
  pv2p = col_double(),
  incumbent = col_logical(),
  incumbent_party = col_logical(),
  prev_admin = col_logical()
))
```

```{r, Graph 1}

popvote %>%
# Create new variable 
  mutate(difference = abs (pv - pv2p)) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=year,y=difference)) +geom_col() +
  labs(title ="Difference in Popular Vote in Presidential Elections from 1948 to 2016",
        subtitle="Democrats versus Republicans",
    x="Year",y= "Difference in Popular Vote") +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold",size=12)) 

  
  
  

```

```{r,Graph 2}

graph2 <- popvote %>%
# Create new variable 
  filter(incumbent_party=="TRUE") %>%
  count(winner=TRUE) 

graph3 <- popvote %>%
# Create new variable 
  filter(incumbent =="TRUE") %>%
  count(winner=TRUE) 
  


  ggplot(aes(x=year,y=difference)) +geom_col() +
  labs(title ="Difference in Popular Vote in Presidential Elections from 1948 to 2016",
        subtitle="Democrats versus Republicans",
    x="Year",y= "Difference in Popular Vote") +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(face = "bold",size=12)) 



```
